data.title: No apparent way to know whether an output channel is shown
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.1.0
- OS Version: Windows

For some reason (https://github.com/bbenoist/vscode-shell/issues/2), I need to know whether an output channel instance is shown or not.

However, I see no way to get the information with current vscode API.

How can I obtain it from my extension?

data.title: Apply excludes to editor history quick open too

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.1.0-alpha
- OS Version: Windows 10

Related #3615

Steps to Reproduce:

I'm working in the smoke test repo ([link](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-smoketest-express))
1. Use quick open `Ctrl+P` to open some files in node_modules folder (I just used index.js as it occurs a lot)
2. Add in settings

``` json
"search.exclude": {
    "**/node_modules": true
}
```
1. Use `Ctrl+P` type 'index.js'

The list of recent files still includes files located in /node_modules. I found a previous thread that says using `Ctrl+K W` will remove them, but excluding them in user settings should also apply to recently opened files without having to use a command to close/remove them.

data.title: spelling errors in .md files
data.body:
Version insiders 1.1.1
OS Windows 8

The spell checker is causing errors. Surely they should merely be warnings.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1707226/15374981/0eaec5c2-1da1-11e6-8a0f-ddfb3f25c080.png)
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1707226/15374999/1cacee88-1da1-11e6-8e6b-04d33476aa87.png)

data.title: Do not steal Cmd + ` shortcut on Mac
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.1.0
- OS Version: OX 10.11.4

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open two VS Code editors
2. Toggle between them using Cmd + ` 

Expected: I should be able to switch between them
Actual: Instead it toggles Terminal inside the application.

data.title: Unable to see intellisense on C/C++ file.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: latest
- OS Version: OS X

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create a .cpp or .c file
2. type printf() or cout <<
3. Expected to see intellisense but none.

data.title: JSX Auto-format adds unnecessary space in attributes
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.1

The .tsx/.jsx auto-formatter adds an unnecessary space on the end of certain dynamic attributes.

E.g. `<button id={fn()} />` becomes `<button id={fn() } />` after the file is auto-formatted. A space is inserted after the closing parenthesis of the fn() call.

The problem appears to be related to having parenthesis in the attribute.

E.g. <button id={""} /> is left unchanged by auto-format. `<button id={("")} />` becomes `<button id={("") } />` (the space is inserted)

I have also observed the auto-formatter preserves the spaces in the id attribute of `<button id={ ("") } />`

data.title: Feature request: CommandOptions at task level in tasks.json
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.1.1
- OS Version: any

CommandOptions is set only at the top level. 
Feature request to make that CommandOptions per task level. So that cwd can be set based on the task.

data.title: Feature request: Override command at task level
Provide .tar.gz/xz Linux package instead of .zip
data.body: Programs typically offer .tar.gz packages instead of zips on Linux.

data.title: Transpiled JS file in same DIR is not found in explorer
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.1.1
- OS Version: Windows 7

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Created a folder and file ../spec/config/element.spec.ts
2. Transpiled to same dir via gulp so I now have ../spec/config/element.spec.js:

gulpfile.js

```
gulp.task("transpile:test", function () {
  var tsResult = tsProjectTest
    .src()
    .pipe(plug.typescript(tsProjectTest))

    tsResult.js
    .pipe(plug.ngAnnotate())
    .pipe(gulp.dest("/spec/"));

  return tsResult.js
    .pipe(gulp.dest("/spec/"));
});
```

tsconfig.json

```
{
  "compileOnSave": true,
  "compilerOptions": {
    "noEmitOnError": true,
    "noImplicitAny": false,
    "removeComments": false,
    "outDir": "/spec/",
    "sourceMap": false,
    "target": "es5",
    "watch": true,
    "preserveConstEnums": true
  },
 "exclude": [
    "node_modules",
    "typings/main",
    "typings/main.d.ts"
  ]
}
```

I can see the JS file in windows explorer and I can search for it (search only found it after exiting VS code and coming back in. A refresh did not work.), but the JS file does not show up in VS code's explorer (I can only see the TS file)

data.title: VSCode's tmLanguage support cannot match zero-width `begin` and `end` correctly.
data.body: cf. Microsoft/vscode-textmate#12

data.title: Screen reader does not read combo-box list items
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.1.0-alpha
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

Using NVDA
1. Open the output box
2. Click on the combo box to change between Extensions/Git/Tasks

Also try using the combo box for selecting a debug configuration. It just reads "combo box expanded, List" and will not read any of the listed items.

data.title: Screen reader not announcing when setting breakpoints
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.1.0-alpha
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

Using NVDA
1. Open a file 
2. Set a breakpoint

Nothing is being read by NVDA when hovered over or when setting a breakpoint.

data.title: EDITOR_INPUT_STATE_CHANGED is a spammer
data.body: When auto save is on this event is fired many times. It should be replaced with something better that fires less often when auto save is on.

data.title: RPM fails to install on opensuse
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Current
- OS Version: x86_64 GNU/Linux

Steps to Reproduce:

error: Failed dependencies:
        git is needed by code-1.1.1-1463146452.x86_64

But I have git installed and working perfectly. In fact I can pull the source from github but not sure how to build it.

Dave

data.title: Install extension of different versions into same path
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.1.1
- OS Version: Windows 10 Enterprise x64

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Install an old version of some extension, like v1.
2. When the extension is updated, update the extension, this  new version like v2, will be installed in a different path.

In this design, it seems hard for extension developer to put necessary files(e.g., a cache/history file needs to persisted during extension usage) into the extension path, since in new version, the file is missing, needs to be regenerated.

So if we could have multiple versions of same extension have same path, in that case the cache/history file can be used when extension is updated.

I am not sure if this request is reasonable, or I just should put this kind of files to a fixed place on machine :blush:

data.title: Provide configuration option for the open in terminal action to use the integrated terminal
Prevent accidentally dragging in tree via hysteresis

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
It's so easy to accidentally drag a folder to another and not even know it, i've done it several times but each time i've been lucky to catch it.  On a huge project this could be a nightmare.  Please alert the user or at least create a preference that allows us to set an alert.

Thanks!

data.title: Typescript autocomplete crash over time
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.1.1
- OS Version: Windows 10 Pro x64

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create a  `TypeScript` project with the following structure : 
   `tsconfig.json`
   `app/`
   `app/application.ts`
   `app/framework/`
   `app/framework/application.ts (included in application.ts)`
   `app/framework/some other typescripts files (included in framework/application.ts)`
   `app/appNameHere/`
   `app/appNameHere/application.ts (included in application.ts)`
   `app/appNameHere/some other typescripts files (included in appNameHere/application.ts)`
   
   So basically : 
   - `app/application.ts` will only contain references to `framework/application.ts` and `appNameHere/application.ts`.
   - `app/framework/application.ts` will only contain references to files from `framework` folder.
   - `app/appNameHere/application.ts` will only contain references to files from `appNameHere` folder.
2. Create a `tsconfig.json` as follow : 
   `{
   "compileOnSave": true,
   "compilerOptions": {
       "target": "es5",
       "removeComments": true,
       "outFile": "application.js",
       "sourceMap": true,
       "noImplicitAny": true
   },
   "files": [
       "app/application.ts"
   ]
   }`
3. Add some TS files in both directory and play with it, try using intellisense of a class from another file
4. Up at some point, TypeScript intellisense seems to crash and to get it again, we need to restart vscode

The Intellisense is crashing a lot in one day on my side with that settings at my job, it will say it doesn't know what is a class that should be defined, until you restart vscode ...

If you need more informations, I'll be glad to offer them. However, I am not in the ability to share my projet as it is confidential files from my job.

data.title: Command line argument documentation and a '--help' option
data.body:
Hello!

Visual Studio Code seems to accept command line arguments for some things, such as disabling extentions and openning to a given path, however they do not seem to be documented anywhere (that I can easily find at least). I'm sure many other users have run into the problem of wanting to know what vscode supports when opened from a terminal and the first thing most of them will try is passing the `--help` option to vscode.

So, my feature request is for a standard help/usage message to be displayed when giving the `--help` option to vscode.

data.title: don't bind cmd+` for the terminal
data.body: The terminal shouldn't use <kbd>Cmd+`</kbd> on the Mac since that's a native shortcut to toggle between different windows of on app

data.title: custom user agent string for marketplace downloads
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.1.1
- OS Version: Windows 7

Hi, in my work environment only certain user agents are allowed to make http(s) requests, so I can't download any extension (`getaddrinfo ENOTFOUND marketplace.visualstudio.com marketplace.visualstudio.com:443`).

I had the same issue with package control for Sublime Text and there you can set a custom user agent string (https://packagecontrol.io/docs/settings) for the downloader.

Can you please implement that for VS Code?

Related: #262

data.title: Detection of duplicate javascript function names !!
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.1.1
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

if we have two or more functions with the same name, there is no syntax highlighting error !!

![sans titre](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9744226/15356433/8dca48ce-1cf0-11e6-83d7-a099d7e9839f.png)

is this feature not yet available in the language services or I miss samething here ?

data.title: Keyboard events should stop dragging
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.1.1
- OS Version: OSX 10.11.4

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Hold left mouse button and drag-select some text
2. Press some keyboard key, to replace or delete the selected text
3. Release left mouse button

Actual Result:
Some texts are selected, depending on the location of the mouse release

Expected result:
No texts are selected. (i.e. keyboard events should finish any pending mouse drags)

Notes:
This operation (the delayed mouse release) may sound unnatural at first place. But on OSX one can use a three-finger gesture to represent a mouse drag, which has a slight delay between the finger release and the actual drag finish, causing the problem to emerge.

data.title: Python error: NotImplementedError: cannot determine number of cpus
data.body:
I try to use sklearn package in python and meet this error.
- VSCode Version:1.1.0
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

```
from sklearn.tree import DecisionTreeRegressor
```

data.title: Smile face and frown face have different "characters left" number
data.body:
- VSCode Version:1.1.1
- OS Version:Windows

Steps to Reproduce:

1.Click the smile face in the bottom right, and you will see the smile face and frown face 
2. Clicking on the smile face, you will see there are 117 chars left, while in frown face you will see 130 chars left.

Not sure if this is a bug, but I am thinking the chars left number should be the same.

data.title: Escape key does not cancel the move to trash dialog
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.1.1
- OS Version: Ubuntu 14.04

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Select a file in the explorer
2. Press the Delete key on the keyboard
3. In the confirmation dialog, press the Esc key on the keyboard
   => The file is sent to trash

Expected Behavior:

The confirmation dialog should close and the file should not be deleted.

data.title: VS Code fails to open big files (60MB)
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.1.1
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Try opening a, let's say, 60MB SQL file
2. VS Code says the file is either too large or in wrong format.
